ygData.messageBody:
Good Point! I have an idea but would be hard to implement. Why doesn't
armor degrade after so many hits to it? If it did then the owner would
have to go to a smith or tailor (depending on armor type) for repair.
That would give smiths a reason to want to raise their level and
everyone would need it.
Bonzz

>The problem with smithing and diminishing prices is the fact that once
>an
>item is created, it usually never leaves circulation. Most, if not all
>
>banded is passed down and sold to others when it no longer has a use.
>What
>this means is that eventually, there will be little to no market for
>banded
>AT ALL. What smiths and other crafters need is some sort of item
>degrade.
>This is the only way to keep the trade skills working indefinitely and
>the
>only way to remove items from circulation.
>
>Also, another major problem with trade skills and the economy as a
>whole is
>the fact that Verant said they would not allow for you to sell back to
>a
>merchant at a profit, then went ahead and did it anyway. I was one
>very few
>people that was a Master at Brewing and Pottery before "The Patch."
>Now
>everyone and their mother is a brewer and a potter simply for the
>exploit.
>Can you imagine what would have happened if this was true for smiths
>and
>jewelers??
>
>Verant needs to stick to its word about no profit from selling to
>merchants.
>Already, no one sells good items any more for plat because plat is
>worthless.
> The current economy just leads to more camping and kill stealing.
>
>Hawkwin of Hawkwin's Roaming Emporium
